content.description: The following table shows summary statistics, in thousands, for the number of electrical workers and the number of concrete workers in the construction industry each month for the past 5 years.
content.question: Type of Worker MinimumFirst Quartile Median Third Quartile Maximum Electrical 239 278 307 320 330 Concrete 186 262 290 308 335 Based on the <math alttext="1.5 times I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mo>Ã—</mo><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> rule for outliers, which of the following statements is a correct comparison of the two distributions?

choices.label: The electrical and concrete distributions both have high outliers.
The electrical and concrete distributions both have lower outliers.
Neither the electrical distribution nor concrete distribution has outliers.
The concrete distribution has at least one lower outlier, and the electrical distribution has no lower outliers.
The concrete distribution has at least one high outlier, and the electrical distribution has no high outliers.

content.answer: The concrete distribution has at least one lower outlier, and the electrical distribution has no lower outliers.

topic.text: 1.9: Comparing Distributions of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
